channel.title: Finding Prime Numbers :: Data Structures in C#
channel.description: Finding Prime Numbers An integer greater than $ 1 $ is said to be prime if it is not divisible by any positive integers other than itself and $ 1 $. Thus, $ 2 $, $ 3 $, and $ 5 $ are prime, but not $ 1 $ (it is not greater than $ 1 $) or $ 4 $ (it is divisible by $ 2 $). Because every integer is divisible by itself and $ 1 $, we will call any other positive factors nontrivial factors; thus, a prime number is an integer greater than $ 1 $ that has no nontrivial factors.
